meanings.definition: Extreme greed for wealth or material gain.
meanings.sent1: His avarice knew no bounds as he hoarded every penny he earned.
meanings.sent2: Her avarice led her to constantly seek ways to increase her wealth.
meanings.sent3: The avarice of the squirrel was evident as it tried to gather more nuts than it could possibly eat.
meanings.sent4: The avarice of the dragon for gold was legendary, with its hoard shining brightly in the cave.
meanings.sent5: The avarice of the king for jewels was so great that he adorned his entire palace with them.

meanings.definition: A strong desire to have or get money.
meanings.sent1: The young entrepreneur's avarice drove him to work day and night to achieve his financial goals.
meanings.sent2: Her avarice for money led her to take on multiple jobs to increase her income.
meanings.sent3: The avarice of the piggy bank for coins was comical as it tried to gobble up every penny.
meanings.sent4: The avarice of the river for gold was reflected in the way it greedily carried the precious metal downstream.
meanings.sent5: The avarice of the beggar for coins was evident as he eagerly collected every cent thrown his way.
